page.title: 17Mr Fred Jordan-Folk Singer
page.content: { Mr Jordan}was born in Ludlow. His father worked in the quarries on Clee Hill.His earliest memories are of his school days when there were 60 or 70 children in a class. He left school at{14}to work on a farm where a lot of his work was with horses.He became interested in horse brasses and now has over{400}in his little cottage,'Washwell Cottage'. Mr Jordan is a well known folk singer and also does gardening and grave digging.He has travelled all over the country from London to Edinburgh to sing and has recorded with the BBC.He knows 205 folk songs learnt from his mother and gypsy travellers. His favourite ballad is "the Outlandish Knight". Fred told a rhyme the reapers used to say as they worked.
